qas.question: In what year was the Fall of France?

context: After the ceasefire following the Fall of <b8_0>France<b8_0/> in <b7_0>June <a0_0><b5_0>1940<b7_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/>, Alsace was annexed to <a1_0>Germany<a1_0/> and a rigorous policy of Germanisation was imposed upon it by the <a2_0>Gauleiter Robert Heinrich Wagner<a2_0/>. When, in <a3_0>July 1940<a3_0/>, the first evacuees were allowed to return, only residents of Alsatian origin were admitted. The last Jews were deported on 15 <b6_0>July 1940<b6_0/> and the main synagogue, a huge Romanesque revival building that had been a major architectural landmark with its <a4_0>54-metre<a4_0/>-high dome since its completion in 1897, was set ablaze, then razed.
